args.natural_language_statement: Let X be a metric space such that every sequence in X has a convergent subsequence. Prove that every open cover of X has a finite subcover.

retrieved_examples.nl: If X is a compact metric space then every sequence has a convergent subsequence.
retrieved_examples.lean:
variable {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X]

lemma sequential_compact_of_compact (h : Compact (univ : Set X)) :
  ‚àÄ (f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X), ‚àÉ (œÜ : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï), StrictMono œÜ ‚àß Filter.Tendsto (f ‚àò œÜ) Filter.atTop (nhds (f (œÜ 0))) := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: Sequential compactness implies countable compactness for first countable spaces.
retrieved_examples.lean:
variable {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] [FirstCountableTopology X]

theorem sequential_compact.countably_compact (h : SequentiallyCompact X) : CountablyCompact X := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Filter

/-- Let X be a metric space such that every sequence in X has a convergent subsequence.
    Then X is compact (every open cover has a finite subcover). -/
theorem compact_of_seq_compact {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X]
  (h : ‚àÄ (f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X), ‚àÉ (s : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï), StrictMono s ‚àß ‚àÉ (x : X), Tendsto (f ‚àò s) atTop (ùìù x)) :
  CompactSpace X := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Filter

/-- Let X be a metric space such that every sequence in X has a convergent subsequence.
    Then X is compact (every open cover has a finite subcover). -/
theorem compact_of_seq_compact {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X]
  (h : ‚àÄ (f : ‚Ñï ‚Üí X), ‚àÉ (s : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñï), StrictMono s ‚àß ‚àÉ (x : X), Tendsto (f ‚àò s) atTop (nhds x)) :
  CompactSpace X := by sorry
